title: Lars Müller
text:
Lars Müller (born 22 March 1976 in <a href="Werne">Werne</a>) is a German former <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player and current head coach of Werner SC.
Career.
Club career.
In his youth, he played for Sportfreunde Werne-West, a sports club based in his hometown, before being signed by SV 1919 Herbern. He then joined <a href="Hammer%20SpVg">Hammer SpVg</a> before being signed by <a href="Bundesliga">Bundesliga</a> club <a href="Borussia%20Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a> in 1995.
He made his Bundesliga debut on 6 April 1996 in a 1–1 draw at home against <a href="Werder%20Bremen">Werder Bremen</a> when he came on for <a href="Lars%20Ricken">Lars Ricken</a> in the 77th minute. After only playing one game in his second year, he moved to second division <a href="KFC%20Uerdingen%2005">KFC Uerdingen 05</a> where he played for three seasons and then to moved to <a href="Alemannia%20Aachen">Alemannia Aachen</a> where he played two season.
From 2001/02 to 2005/06 he played for <a href="1.%20FC%20N%C3%BCrnberg">1. FC Nürnberg</a>. For the 2006/07 season he moved to the <a href="2.%20Bundesliga">2. Bundesliga</a> club <a href="FC%20Augsburg">FC Augsburg</a>, where he became a regular player in 2008/09 season. After the end of the 2008/09 season, Müller was not not a part of the plans at Augsburg under the new coach and therefore, he wasn't offered a new contract. In the summer 2009, he therefore moved to <a href="RB%20Leipzig">RB Leipzig</a>.
Later and coaching career.
In the summer 2011, Müller moved to <a href="Hammer%20SpVg">Hammer SpVg</a> as a player-head coach. After his release in November 2012, he took over the post of sporting director until the end of the season.
In June 2017, he was appointed head coach of Werner SC. As of February 2020, he was still the club's head coach.
